results.title: The Canadians
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film traces Canada’s evolution, and the contributions of people at home and from many lands including Yousuf Karsh, Lester B. Pearson and Dr. Wilder Penfield. It explores the country from coast to coast and to the farthest reaches of the Arctic, bringing to the screen lively impressions of this second largest country in the world.

results.title: The Camel boy
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In Australia’s early days the ship of the desert, the camel, was imported to help explore the harsh interior of this vast continent. Through the wonder of animation and live action ‘The Camel Boy’ takes you back to the beginning of this century for an exciting adventure story based on the actual journeys of explorers in Australia’s outback wilderness. The burning sands of the inland desert and the hurricane lashed waters of the ocean are the setting for this story of friendship between a boy and a camel.

results.title: The Caleche driver
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Much of the old-world charm of Quebec city can be accredited to the open, horse-drawn carriages in which visitors may explore the city - and to the drivers of these ancient vehicles. In this film we get to know Onesime Lamothe, veteran trooper of Quebec’s historic avenues and ever-ready fountain of knowledge.

results.title: Living Legacy : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight very different people tell of how Legacy came into their lives, the bonds they formed, the support of Legacy and how Legacy has remained with them throughout their lives.

results.title: Marketing: distribution strategy
results.creator_credit: Paul Bosner and Dallas County Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Business file.”.
Alex Burton questions Professors John Coyle and Donald Bowersox on product distribution as part of the marketing mix. Distribution is defined as putting the right product in the right place at the right time in the right quantity and is essential in the provision of customer service. Simple and complex distribution channels are described, some involving many “middle men” and some involving only the supplier and the customer. The managing director of Celestial Seasonings then describes the problems of distribution and how he has solved them.

results.title: The Canadian shield: Saguenay region
results.creator_credit: Werner Aellen, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film focuses on the Saguenay area of Quebvec as seen from a helicopter. From this vantage point, the size and resources - wood, water, arable land and mineral-bearing rock are easy to see. At closer range the film shows the industries and agricultural development of the region.

results.title: The Business file.
results.creator_credit: Paul Bosner and Dallas County Community College
results.brief_description: Hosted by Alex Burton this series of four educational films deals with various topics related to marketing. Each program interviews academic experts on theory and then takes the example of one company’s approach to the topic in hand.

results.title: The Canadian air connection
results.creator_credit: Douglas Cameron, Colin Low, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film made for the Canadian Armed Forces that shows how refuelling is done in mid-air when it is necessary to send smaller airplanes on long missions.

results.title: The Camomile lawn
results.creator_credit: Peter Hall, Glenn Wilhide, Sophie Balhetchet, ABC-TV (Australia), Channel Four and ZED Ltd
results.brief_description: It is August 1939, and Helena and Richard Cuthbertson with their young niece, Sophy, are preparing for the annual visit to Cornwall, where they meet with Richard’s other nephews and nieces - Oliver, Calypso, Polly and Walter. Sophy is resented by her aunt and has little in common with her invalid uncle, who lost a leg in the trenches. The cousins plan to run the ‘terror run’ - a fearless night-time dash along the cliff path. Helena and Richard invite Max and Monika Erstweiler - Austrian refugees to the ritual dinner before the ‘terror run’. Max is a renowned classical violinist, and he and Monika believe their only son is now in a concentration camp. The night is brought abruptly to an end by news from Polly and Walter’s father that the hospital where he is a surgeon is about to be evacuated. War must be imminent… Based on the novel by Mary Wesley. Stars Felicity Kendal and Paul Eddington.

results.title: The Cadillac
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Jerry Fitzgerald, Pete Rodriguez and Robert Clouse Associates
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the father in a Mexican-American family who wins a Cadillac car, forms grandiose plans for its use without regard to his inadequate income, makes himself unpopular by his over-solicitous care of the automobile, but is brought to his senses in a subtly worked out resolution. Uses still picture technique.
